title: Rotational dynamics - torque from tension force

content.prompt: A block of mass m0 hangs from a string that passes over a pulley and is wrapped around a horizontal disk of radius R0, as shown in the diagram. The masses of the string and the pulley are negligible. The block is released from rest and begins moving downward. Does the string exert a torque on the disk, about the center of the disk, equal to m0gR0 ? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the only unbalanced external force exerted on the block-disk system is the gravitational force on the hanging block.
Yes, because the force of tension equals the force of gravity acting on the block.
No, because the tension is independent of the mass of the block.
No, because the tension in the string is less than the weight of the hanging block.
